*Tycker du också det är spännande med utveckling i .NET och React.js och har ett hjärta som slår för samhällsförändring? Då är den här tjänsten något för dig!*
**Vad gör vi?**
 Vi på Decerno är specialister på skräddarsydda digitala lösningar och är stolta över att våra uppdrag bidrar till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Det betyder att vi förstår att alla kunder är olika och har unika förutsättningar. Vi skräddarsyr våra lösningar utefter kundens behov vilket medför att vi kan erbjuda våra medarbetare ett smörgåsbord av spännande projekt och tekniker.
   

  

 Samtidigt som vi skapar digitala lösningar vill vi också göra skillnad på riktigt. Det är inte bara något vi säger, vi menar det! Sedan vår start 1984 har vår etiska policy varit vår kompass och vi väljer aktivt bort projekt inom vapenindustri, spel, tobak och alkohol.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer får du en varierad vardag och möjlighet att jobba inom (men inte uteslutande med):
   

  

* Utveckling, främst i React, .NET/C#, SQL eller Azure


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid att bemanna våra projekt med Decernos egna anställda och tillsammans delar ni med er av olika erfarenheter och hjälper varandra genom projektets alla faser.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm med möjlighet att arbeta på distans när det passar. Vi tror på att kunna erbjuda våra medarbetare stor flexibilitet och möjligheten att balansera egna behov och förutsättningar med projektets krav. Vissa projekt kan dock kräva en viss fysisk närvaro för att bygga starka relationer med våra kunder och lära känna deras verksamhet på bästa sätt.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
* Du har ett intresse för fullstackutveckling
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av C#/.NET och React.js eller Typescript
* Du är flytande i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Du har en högskoleutbildning eller erfarenhet som motsvarar utbildningen


 Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Azure, DevOps, integrationer, .NET web API, CSS, AI eller maskininlärning. Vi ser också gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och kommunicerar enkelt och ärligt med dina kollegor.
   

  

**Därför ska du välja** 
**Decerno**
 I våra medarbetarundersökningar blir det gång på gång tydligt att det är de fantastiska kollegorna, de roliga och utmanande projekten och möjligheten att kunna bidra till samhällsnytta som gör att våra medarbetare trivs så bra på Decerno.
   

  

 Sedan finns det också några ytterligare aspekter vilka vi ser som självklarheter:
   

  

* En flexibel arbetsplats med större frihet att planera vardagen för att få arbete och privatliv att gå ihop
* Extra föräldraförmåner eftersom vi tycker att familjen är viktigast
* Vi tycker att din kompetensutveckling är viktig! Därför anordnar vi interna utbildningar löpande i vår egen Dec Academy, gör satsningar inom AI, håller i bokcirklar och arrangerar årliga konferenser
* Vi vill att du ska må bra, trivas och ha roligt på arbetet och därför arrangerar vi regelbundet olika sociala aktiviteter, utmaningar och hälsotävlingar – såväl virtuellt som på plats


 Utöver detta erbjuder vi även ett brett förmånspaket som inkluderar bland annat friskvårdsbidrag och ett generöst försäkringspaket. Vi berättar gärna mer om du vill veta vad mer vi på Decerno skulle kunna erbjuda dig.
   

  

**Låter detta som ditt nästa steg i karriären?** 
  

  

 Vad kul! Då ser vi fram emot att läsa din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta HR-generalist på
 **klara.zetterberg@decerno.se** 
 .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra hur vi kan bli ditt nästa steg i karriären!

title: Logistics Analyst / Logistics Developer
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Instabox and Budbee - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands - Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and continues to innovate to make your e-commerce deliveries even simpler. Always with our people, the merchants and our consumers at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We have an amazing group of people at Instabee who are passionate, take ownership and never settle for what we have. It’s a vibrant office culture with an international feeling. People are smart, open, humble and wanting to learn. You will get a lot of responsibility for someone at this level, and be coached by some great colleagues and managers. We have a culture where everyone wants to help each other.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Logistics Analyst / Logistics Developer, you will be responsible for strategy, design and analysis for first- and middle routes at Instabee. This means collaborating with our Market teams in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway and Netherlands to improve the efficiency and accuracy of our transport routes between merchant warehouses and Instabee terminals in different countries/cities. The focus is on designing and optimising the network of routes, ensuring great data available to guide Market teams, and that we have the appropriate tools to support these operations. You will be a part of the Logistics Team, who are some of the most talented and friendly people in the organisation, and report directly to the VP Logistics, to support your learning and development.
   

  

**In this role, your tasks will include, but are not limited to:**
* Together with VP Logistics, setting the vision and strategic direction for our first- and middle-mile operations.
* Analysing and designing our first- and middle-mile transport to find improvement opportunities in conjunction with your counterparts in the Markets
* Ensuring high quality through first- and middle-mile operations
* Collaborating with your product colleagues from routing and delivery execution to develop tools for your area.
* Building dashboards to support best-practice sharing


**About You**
* You would be a smart, strategic, logical and lateral thinker, who is able to evaluate complex inter-linked systems.
* You are highly analytical and data-driven with high attention to detail and a solid problem solver.
* You work in a structured way to drive improvements, ensuring you have the highest impact.
* You have solid collaborative skills and are good at building relationships and teamwork with internal stakeholders


**More about You**
* Education in mathematics, physics, engineering, statistics or similar.
* Solid analytical skills and the ability to break down strategic goals to actionable pieces.
* Potentially work experience in an analytical environment.
* Experience with SQL or R/Python or Excel/Google Sheets is an advantage.


**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town.
   

  

 Fun Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?**

 **Our mission** is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ️


**At our new office**, you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating a positive and social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! ️  

  

**We are proud** to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation!


**THE ROLE**


We are expanding our Shared Data team with a dedicated Data Engineer. This role offers the opportunity to actively contribute to the architecture and design of our data platform, influencing how data is utilized across the company. Your primary responsibilities will involve coding in Python, integrating new data into our data warehouse, and delivering high-quality data solutions to both internal and external customers.


This position provides the unique advantage of working on diverse projects across various teams, helping them derive insights to enhance their products. You will also have the opportunity to see your work in action by testing product changes - whether it’s analyzing results or even swinging a golf club.


You are someone who quickly adapts to new technologies and enjoys applying the right tools to tackle complex tasks. With an open mind, you evaluate multiple solutions, balancing their pros and cons. We believe you are passionate about coding, problem-solving, and understanding the requirements of data-driven analysis and services. You thrive in delivering end-to-end solutions, taking a project from concept to a fully functional system.


If you’re eager to join a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and impactful work, we’d love to hear from you!

**TECH STACK**


Python | PostgreSQL  

(required)  

  

AWS | RabbitMQ | Kafka | Redshift | dbt | Airflow  

(knowledge of at least a few, but proficiency in all not required)

 **POSSIBILITIES**

* Innovate to make golf more accessible
* High degree of impact on the Toptracer data platform
* Broad range of technology and development opportunities
* Close collaboration with multiple teams and products

Working in an agile environment  
* 

**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE**

* 4+ years of experience working as a software engineer with focus on data
* 3+ years of experience working in Python
* Experience in working in a cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS
* Experience in building ETL/ELT pipelines
* Experience with a warehouse solution, preferably Redshift

**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER**  

  

**Workplace**

  

We value fully engaged associates that come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share and the product we are developing.


In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.

**Culture**


Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence. If you want to learn more about them visit: Core Values | Topgolf.

 **Activities**

  

* Morning Fikas
* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!


The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Danderyd. Hit the link at the bottom of the page to read more about the team. We hope to hear from you soon!

**Social media**


Instagram


LinkedIn

  

Youtube


Website

title: Software Engineer
description:
We are a dynamic and technology consulting company providing skilled consultants to our clients for both inhouse and external customers projects . We are committed to delivering high-quality software solutions that meet and exceed client expectations. Our team thrives on collaboration, continuous learning, and excellence.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

We are seeking a skilled Software Test Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products through comprehensive testing, meticulous attention to detail, and effective communication.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases for software applications.
  
Perform manual and automated testing to identify and report bugs, issues, and performance bottlenecks.
  
Collaborate with development teams to understand requirements and provide feedback on design and functionality.
  
Create and maintain detailed documentation of test cases, procedures, and outcomes.
  
Develop and implement automated testing scripts and tools to streamline testing processes.
  
Conduct regression, integration, and system testing to ensure the quality of deliverables.
  
Continuously improve testing processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance efficiency.
  
Monitor and track software performance metrics to ensure compliance with quality standards.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  
Proven experience as a Software Test Engineer or similar role.
  
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
  
Proficiency in writing test scripts using tools like Selenium, JUnit, or similar.
  
Experience with manual and automated testing frameworks.
  
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.
  
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
  
  

**Preferred Skills:**  

Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, Java, or C#.
  
Experience with performance and security testing.
  
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins or GitLab.
  
Certification in software testing (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) is a plus.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Competitive salary and benefits package.
  
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
  
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
  
Flexible work arrangements (e.g., remote or hybrid).
  
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools.

title: IT- Specialist inom X86
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och senior IT-servicetekniker med focus på datorarkitekturen X86 till en av våra kunder i Borås. Som servicetekniker inom området kommer du ansvara för installationer, uppdateringar samt uppgraderingar av persondatorer och servrar. Om detta låter som något för dig, så tveka inte och sök redan idag!

**Vi erbjuder dig**

* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor

**Om tjänsten**


Som konsult i rollen som IT specialist inom x86 hos aktuell kund i Borås kommer du att ansvara för installation av skrivare, etablering av Co-pilot på specifika maskiner, uppdatera Oracle Java samt uppdatera Linux-system och hålla dem säkra. Du kommer även uppgradera operativsystem, upptäcka, analysera och rapportera om säkerhetsbrister och sårbarheter. Dessutom kommer du få byta nätverk på datorer och servrar, arbeta med byte av Active Directory samt ansvara för uppsättning av MFA. För detta uppdrag finns det möjlighet att arbeta upp till 50 % på distans.


**Vi ser gärna att du**

* Har erfarenhet av datorarkitekturen x86
* Har tidigare arbetat med ärendehantering
* Har erfarenhet av Active Directory, MFA, Microsoft 365, Oracle Java samt Linux
* Är lösningsorienterad och har ett analytiskt tänkande
* Är strukturerad och noggrann som person
* Har ett genuint IT-intresse
* Behärskar Svenska i både tal och skrift


För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du är duktig på felsökning och tar egna initiativ. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp.

**Mer om Nexer Infrastructure**


Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och att framtidssäkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.


Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunchträffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.

**Ansökan**


Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: Senior Software Engineer - HW
description:
Are you a Senior Software Developer looking for your next challenge? Do you want to develop advanced medical equipment that helps laboratories around the world? Sounds interesting? Keep on reading!


CellaVision works to advance laboratory workflow and diagnostic certainty through intelligent microscopy. We are a world leader in digital microscopy and offer a full solution including instruments and reagents. Our products are used in health care services around the globe.

**What do we offer?**


The Software team within our Hardware department is growing and looking for an additional Software Engineer! CellaVision develops advanced medical equipment with high requirements on reliability, accuracy, image quality, and throughput.


As a member of the Software team in the Hardware department, you will develop and maintain the embedded software and PC software for the analyzers and accessories. The analyzers are equipped with high resolution optics, precision mechanics and specialized image processing. The Hardware department consists of mechanical, software and electronics engineers, each contributing with their specific knowledge and cooperate in solving interdisciplinary problems and turning ideas into products. You will participate in the whole development process of medical devices while working in an international environment where quality, development, and innovation are constantly in focus.

**Key tasks as a Senior Software Engineer**


Develop and maintain our software, both in an embedded and application environment.


Develop and maintain PC software for controlling the embedded systems.


Decide and develop the Software Architecture or our applications, taking the helicopter perspective understanding how all of the individual pieces fit together into a bigger picture.


Participate in the design of systems using a combination of PC software, embedded software, electronics, mechanics, and optics.


Review designs, reports, and source code contributions from colleagues.


Participated in testing and the designing of tests for individual components and the fully assembled product.


Share your knowledge and experiences with colleagues.

**What can we offer you?**


You get the chance to develop CellaVision’s advanced medical equipment with high requirements on reliability, accuracy, image quality, and throughput. The CellaVision hematology analyzers are equipped with high-resolution optics, precision mechanics, and specialized image processing. The Hardware department consists of mechanical, software, and electronics engineers, each contributing with their specific knowledge and cooperating in solving interdisciplinary problems and turning ideas into products.


CellaVision has a world-leading position in digital cell morphology, and we see our employees as our primary resource for our ongoing innovation and success. Joining CellaVision means that you will surround yourself with over 180 passionate and ambitious colleagues.

**To be successful in the role you need to have**


M.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering or equivalent.


5-7 years of experience as a C++ or C# developer


Very strong programming skills, especially in modern C++.


You have an ability to understand and design the architecture of large software systems.


Interest in acquiring new skills and programming languages as the need arises and a curious attitude.


You have a solid sense of responsibility. You take initiatives and come up with new proposals for working methods.


Good English communication skills, both verbal and written.

**It is also meritorious if you already have**


Experience with the development and maintenance of embedded Linux systems.


Experience and interest in working with Windows PC systems.


Knowledge in C# or VHDL/Verilog.

**Are you ready to make a difference?**


Apply to this job by filling in the application form and attaching your CV/personal letter. Please prepare to have your documents, such as certificates, credentials, and recommendations, for a potential interview. We review applications continuously, so please send us yours as soon as possible.


This is a full-time position that starts as soon as possible, based at CellaVision HQ in Lund, Sweden with new offices, good infrastructure, and commuting possibilities. To know more about the position, please contact recruiting manager Gunnar Hansen, Engineering Manager, at gunnar.hansen@cellavision.se


Questions about the recruitment process contact Edmond Kasparian, HR Business Partner, at Edmond.kasparian@cellavision.se


Please note that you need a valid working permit in Sweden for this role.


We respectfully decline all contacts regarding additional channels, campaigns, or recruitment support.

**Diversity is in our blood**


At CellaVision we understand not only the uniqueness of blood cells but also of people. We strongly believe in the power of diversity and recognize it as a driver of innovation. We are committed to building an inclusive culture for all our people.


CellaVision is a non-discriminatory workplace where qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, nationality, ethnic or social origin, age, religion, political orientation, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, family or marital status, pregnancy, disability, or any other basis prohibited by law.

**More about us**


CellaVision was established in Sweden in 1994 with a vision to simplify, standardize, and digitize the manual analysis of blood cells in hematology laboratories. The company’s long-term success is a result of our commitment to innovation. Our goal is to provide value to patients, customers, and distributors by incorporating smart solutions into everything we do. Our research and development focus on offering superior analytical and diagnostic certainty by creating an ecosystem that combines reagents with hardware and software. Today CellaVision has 250 employees, with global Headquarters in Lund, Sweden.


The company has market support offices in 16 markets and a presence in over 40 countries with reagent development and manufacturing performed in Martillac, France.


For more information visit www.cellavision.com

**Please expect a delay in our response time due to the holiday season. Your patience is appreciated.**

title: Future Opportunities
description:
Future Graduates
   

  

 Sana is leading the way in an unprecedented time, with AI enabling change that will be more significant than the internet revolution. In this unprecedented moment, what we do one day can be obsolete the next. This requires extreme intuition, strategic minds, bold tradeoffs, and not least, grit. For the right person, it’s equally challenging as it is rewarding, as we’re doing something every day worth recounting to future generations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This is an open application for those who are graduating in the upcoming years and would like to be part of a dynamic team. Whether you're in Operations, Marketing, Customer Success, Go-to-Market, or Product, your future role will involve identifying emerging market needs and trends, contributing to product development, and understanding how Sana can address the challenges faced by leading global organizations. You'll help shape the future strategies and structures within your team, focusing on expanding into new markets, supporting strategic initiatives, and developing the tools and processes that enable Sana to scale effectively
   

  

 What Will Help You Thrive
   

  

* Currently enrolled in a recognized university.
* Speak fluent English, and preferably one more European/Nordic language.
* Possess entrepreneurial spirit and adaptability, alongside a relentless determination to deliver and achieve targets.
* Passion about workforce efficiencies and deeply committed to continuous learning and development.
* A humble and curious mind.
* Enthusiasm about starting a career with Sana post-graduation


**What We Offer**
* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in NYC, London, and Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**About Sana**

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Let's build the future together!
   

  

 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by 9000+ companies and has users in 90 countries around the world .
   

  

 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a real impact on the growth of an organisation and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun!
   

  

 In this role you will be responsible for building, configuring and automating technology solutions that drive business value ($$ or time-improvement) for 300+ CRM users (and growing rapidly) across Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Support. We are therefore looking for a real problem solver with exceptional project management skills that knows how Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Support works!
   

  

 As a Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst at Teamtailor, you will be responsible for:
   

  

**Platform Management:** 
 Making sure that Salesforce always runs with the latest releases and manage all day-to-day functionalities, such as (but not limited to):
   

  

* User and Access Management
* Security
* Technical setup (Fields, Objects, Report Types.. etc..)
* Release Management
* Change set deployments
* Flows (!!!)
* Basically almost everything that happens in Salesforce Setup


**Improving Commercial processes:** 
 Use Tech to improve real business challenges
   

  

* Improve the efficiency of business operations by proactively undertaking regular process analysis and documentation.
* Solve business problems using the Salesforce Platform.
* Create human-centred user experiences in Salesforce.
* Manage changes to business processes, technology, and people within Salesforce.
* Create, maintain, and enhance automated business processes.


**Data Management:** 
 Make sure that data enters/leaves the platform deduplicated, accurately and actionable.
   

  

* Create processes to ensure data in Salesforce is managed correctly.
* Manage the information architecture and ensure that information flows accurately between internal objects and external systems.


**Project Management:** 
 Plan and oversee Salesforce projects to ensure they’re completed on time and within budget.
   

  

**Data Steward:** 
 Proactively set up processes to manage and protect customer and business data and be the point of contact for the DPO.
   

  

**Additionally, We Are Looking For Someone Who Has**
* At least 3+ years of experience Salesforce Administration
* Thorough understanding of Salesforce Governor Limits
* Good understanding of Salesforce integration possibilities
* Understands Commercial GTM strategies. You understand how Marketing attracts prospective customers, how sales closes deals, how CSM teams prevent churn and how Support delivers exceptional service (we prefer a person who has a bit of trouble configuring a http callout in a flow, but knows exactly how Sales work, rather than someone who knows exactly how to configure a http callout in a flow but doesn’t know how sales sells).
* Experience managing projects from inception to completion.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Salesforce Administrator certification


**Want to see what Teamtailor is? Here is a short product video**
 If this sounds like you, then you know what to do!
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application.**

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.



Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We're the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it's still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you'll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.


**Summary**



As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you'll be responsible for planning and executing strategies to drive customer adoption and use of the Wiz platform. You will provide both strategic and hands-on technical guidance to customers throughout the Wiz journey, from onboarding to operationalization.



Technical expertise and strong customer-facing skills will be essential in address both the business and technical needs of our customers. Serving as the bridge between customers and the broader Wiz team, you'll streamline collaboration between Product Management, Sales, Engineering and Support for a cohesive customer experience.



Join Wiz as a TAM to contribute to customer success and to be a part of an innovative and collaborative company that values excellence and growth.


**What you'll do**


* Provide customers with expert guidance on deployment, operational best practices, and assist in establishing a Wiz Center of Excellence.
* Serve as the primary Wiz liaison for technical questions or escalations, collaborating with Support, Product Management, and other relevant teams.
* Contribute to workshops aimed at helping customers unlock the full value of the Wiz platform.
* Develop trusted advisor relationships and establish a regular cadence with customer stakeholders from practitioners to C-level, with a focus on increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and fostering satisfaction.
* Help customers develop Success Plans, outlining critical goals and key performance indicators, and provide guidance in achieving these objectives.
* Measure customers' achievement of these key performance indicators and report those both internally and externally.
* Identify and address technical issues to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction. Collaborate with Engineering and Support teams to resolve technical escalations quickly and efficiently.
* Advocate for customer needs across various departments (product management, support, ...).
* Offer insights regarding the availability of new features in Wiz. Program manage account escalations effectively.
* Collaborate with the Wiz Sales and Renewal teams to secure contract renewals.
* Assist in identifying opportunities for expanding Wiz usage across the customer's organization.
* Maintain up-to-date functional and technical knowledge of the Wiz platform.
* Continuously monitor news related to new & emerging cloud security threats.
* Grow your knowledge of the Wiz ecosystem (Cloud Service Providers, Technology partners, ...)


**What you'll bring**


* 3+ years of experience in technical customer facing roles, for example: Technical Account Manager, Professional Services, Solutions Engineering, Technical Support, Customer Success Engineer.
* Strong understanding of cloud services, architectures, and security best practices, with CSP level certifications (e.g., Certified Solutions Architect, Certified DevOps Engineer) preferred.
* Familiarity with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and the security considerations associated with them.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues and drive resolution.
* Proven track record of building and maintaining relationships with enterprise clients, driving customer success, and exceeding performance targets.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels of an organization.
* B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar field, or equivalent experience.
* Verbal and written fluency in the Swedish language

  



If your experience is close but doesn't fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.



Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.



By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör med intresse för teknik och att ständigt utvecklas? Vill du hjälpa våra kunder att göra världen lite bättre? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom exempelvis fordon, fintech, myndigheter, medtech och telekom. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av elkraftsystem till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla.
   

  

 Rollen som DevOps-ingenjör hos oss är en omväxlande roll, med arbete på olika nivåer, där du får en chans att delta i våra kunders DevOps-resa utifrån deras mognadsgrad.
   

  

**Matchar vi?**
 Vi söker dig som blir uttråkad av att göra samma sak två gånger och genast börjar hacka ihop en automatiserad lösning istället. Vi ser gärna att du har automatiserat något som absolut inte behövdes automatiseras! Kanske hemma?
   

  

 De som jobbar med DevOps på HiQ har ofta en kodtung utbildning och har jobbat som DevOps engineer i några år. Vi ser gärna att du har en liknande bakgrund, då vi oftast tar oss an Stockholms mer avancerade uppdrag.
   

  

**Checklist**
* Högskole-/Universitetsexamen inom datateknik, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annan relevant inriktning
* Minst 3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Det är ett stort plus om du har tidigare erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Scripting
* Säkerhet
* Monitorering
* CI/CD-tekniker
* Containeriseringsverktyg och molnlösningar
* Automation i produktionsmiljö med många noder
* IP-nätverk, VPN, DNS, lastbalanserare och brandväggar
* Seamless/automatiserade byggscript för release management i olika miljöer


 Vi ser också gärna att du tidigare byggt sofistikerad infrastruktur med en hög grad av automation och är en förespråkare av infrastructure-as-code.

title: Build Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 As a Build Engineer you will be critical in ensuring that our development teams can work efficiently with quick access to feedback and information, collaborating with many parts of the organization. Together with your team, you will also support bringing our in-house titles to hundreds of thousands of gamers in a fun and engaging work environment that is always looking to build and improve.
   

  

 Responsibilities include the administration of source control and continuous integration servers. Management of services and processes for deployment of internal builds and public game releases. Development of systems that provide timely feedback and analytics to developers and service users as well as the investigation and promotion of new technologies and better testing procedures.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Experience of Linux / macOS server administration.
* Experience managing continuous integration systems such as Gitlab CI or Jenkins.
* Experience managing version control systems such as Git and Subversion.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Service minded approach with a passion for providing and improving critical development services.


**Experience In The Following Will Be Considered a Plus**
* Experience with Bash scripting or Python.
* Experience of working with and maintaining provisioning systems such as Terraform.
* Experience of working with configuration management systems such as Ansible or Chef.
* Experience building and configuring networks and server installation or maintenance.


 The right candidate is passionate about our games and believes that developer efficiency is key to making great experiences. As a key member of the PDS Tech team many developers will rely on your expertise and the services you maintain so you should be both service minded and confident in accepting responsibility. At Paradox, we pride ourselves in providing opportunities to develop and learn new skills so we are looking for candidates who are interested in expanding their talents and working with new technologies.
   

  

**Practical Information**
 Scope: Full-time and permanent
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Reports To: PDS Tech Lead
   

  

 We will only recruit locally for this position
   

  

*If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously for this position. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in Paradox might compensate for this.*
*Since we strive for a more even gender distribution we highly encourage women to apply to this role.*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: AWS Databricks Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Cognizant is a global leader within Information Technology Services (Fortune 500 since 2011). The company was founded in 1994, and the Head Quarters is still in USA. Cognizant, which was originally Dun & Bradstreets own inhouse bureau, serves the market with vertical solutions for digital automation (cloud, AI, IoT and analytics). Cognizant operates in industries like Health Care, Life Science, Banking and Finance, Insurance, Retail, Production, Logistics, Energy etc and is a key player within the Digital revolution. Cognizant Global has a revenue of USD 17 billion and nearly 300 000 employees. To strengthen the Nordic team within Artificial Intelligence & Analytics SME Team, Cognizant is now looking to hire a: AWS/AZURE Databricks Architect – lead, Cognizant Nordics.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you interested in working in a global company helping market-leading clients solve strategic data and analytical challenges? Can you see yourself in a diverse environment where your daily work consists of global collaborations across industries and professions? Then you might be the one we are looking to hire for our Artificial Intelligence and Analytics Advisory SME team. At Cognizant you get the dynamic and entrepreneurial freedom of a small organization, yet the professionalism and long-term sustainability of a large organization. We are a small Nordic practice with aggressive growth ambitions. We are agile enough to engage with clients on their most strategic initiatives and have the knowhow and financial strength to deliver the most challenging change programs. “Engineering Modern business to improve everyday life “ is Cognizant’s agenda to solve business problems such as monitoring CO2 emission in logistics for sustainability, solutions for anti-money laundering in banking and Data-driven transparency in manufacturing. Our SME practice is rated leader by Forrester (AI consulting firms report).
   

  

**About The Role**
 The AWS /AZURE Databricks Architect – lead role requires good skills in the development of data engineering solutions using various services required for data architecture on Databricks delta lake, streaming, AZURE, AWS, ETL Development, and data modelling. Understanding of Data Warehouse and Data Lakehouse paradigms.
   

  

**AWS/AZURE Databricks Architect – Lead Include**
* Own the design and implementation of scalable and secure solutions using Databricks and AWS or AZURE
* Be responsible for the development and deployment of data pipelines and workflows to ensure efficient data processing.
* Collaborate with multi-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Ensure the architecture aligns with industry standard processes and regulatory requirements.
* Implement robust security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
* Monitor system performance and implement vital adjustments to maintain optimal functionality.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the architecture.
* Engage with customers and principal architects understand the business requirements and build AWS or Azure cloud big data platform and solutions


**About You**
 Professionally, you have a university degree in business administration, engineering or related field. We think that you have 2-3 years’ experience in Consulting or relevant project experience with premier organization(s).
   

  

 We also believe you have a strong experience in developing data lakes, and datamarts on the Databricks platform. Furthermore, strong skill sets in AWS Data Lake services such as - AWS Glue, S3 Lambda, SNS, IAM, and skills Spark, Python, and SQL. Or Microsoft Azure – Pureview and Fabric experience.
   

  

 You are used to working with global and regional clients on a senior and preferably executive level. You are experienced in delivering strategy definitions and/or Artificial intelligence and analytics transformation programs across industry sectors and in different client contexts.
   

  

 For this role you need to be fluent in English and one of the Nordics Languages (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish or Finnish).
   

  

 Personally, you have strong interpersonal and leadership skills and an entrepreneurial mindset, as you like to creatively explore and contribute to continuous improvements. You are a doer and can proactively identify, prioritize, qualify and convert opportunities. We think that you are a genuine leader, characterized by integrity, creativity, accountability, communication and respect. We believe that hard work can go hand in hand with an informal and collaboratively work culture.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**Join Paligo as a Technical Support Engineer!**

 **Who We Are**  

Paligo is an industry-leading SaaS company in the field of Component Content Management Systems (CCMS). We empower global teams to create, manage, publish, and translate technical documentation using our cloud-based platform. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies such as Amazon, Allianz, Mitsubishi, the European Commission, and Gong, our goal is to become the top solution in our industry.


To achieve this, we need exceptional individuals like YOU to take us to the next level!

 **About the Role**


As demand for our platform grows, we're expanding our Technical Support team. We're seeking a Technical Support Agent to deliver fast, friendly, and effective solutions to our customers through Zendesk and Intercom. You'll take ownership of resolving customer issues and contribute to improving Paligo's systems and processes. Working closely with our talented Developer team, you'll gain in-depth knowledge of our platform's capabilities. Our Technical Support team is a critical part of Paligo’s reputation for outstanding customer care.


This role will be based in our brand-new HQ in Solna Strand, Stockholm. As the first Technical Support Agent in Sweden, you’ll be a key part of our global support team while working closely with Product, Engineering, and the Commercial teams, also located at our HQ.  

  

**What You'll Do**

* Provide technical support to customers via Zendesk and Intercom.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring timely and effective solutions.
* Collaborate with the Developer team to continuously improve support processes.
* Gain expertise in Paligo’s platform and share insights with customers and internal teams,

 **About You**

  

We’re looking for a team player who loves supporting customers and thrives in a fast-paced environment. You’re detail-oriented, eager to learn, and have excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively across teams.

 **Required Skills and Experience:**

* 2-3 years of experience in a technical support role, ideally supporting a complex SAAS product.
* Proficiency with Zendesk or similar CRM tools is a strict requirement
* Excellent troubleshooting skills and technical problem-solving abilities.
* Experience with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.
* Fluent in English.


**Nice-to-Haves:**

* Familiarity with documentation platforms (CCMS, HAT etc.)

  

**What We Offer**


At Paligo, you’ll have the chance to make a real impact while working in a collaborative, innovative, and inclusive environment. We offer:

* Impactful Work: Your contributions will directly influence our growth and success as we scale globally.
* Competitive benefits and flexible working hours.
* Opportunities for professional growth and skill development.
* A supportive culture that prioritizes health, work-life balance, and team connection.

 **Ready to Join Us?**


If you’re excited about the opportunity to be part of a dynamic, rapidly growing company with a global presence, we’d love to hear from you!


Apply today and become a vital part of Paligo’s journey to reshape the world of content management. We will start with the screening process after the Holidays.

title: Senior Financial Controller
description:
**Vi söker en Senior Financial Controller till ett internationellt bolag i Stockholm. Start snarast möjligt, 9 månaders uppdrag till att börja med.**


Som Financial Controller ansvarar konsulten för konsolideringen och rapportering av finansiella siffror till group accounting i Norge


Konsulten ska arbeta med konsolideringen samt lämna över uppgifterna till shared service center och sätta en process mellan kunden och Shared service center. Konsulten kommer även att arbeta med övriga projekt som vi har inom Financial Control när vi inte är i bokslut.


**Krav / Kvalifikationskriterier**

* Erfarenhet av koncernredovisning
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet med tyngdpunkt inom kvalificerad redovisning
* Goda kunskaper inom svenska redovisningsregelverk K3 och IFRS
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel och van vid att hantera stora mängder data
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete och processutveckling
* Erfarenhet av större bolag med komplex verksamhet och systemmiljö
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med shared service center
* Håller deadlines
* Analytisk
* Flytande kunskaper i både svenska och engelska

**Önskvärda färdigheter:**

* Oracle EPM Cloud/FCC
* Gillar att samarbeta samt innehar mycket goda kommunikativa och sociala förmågor, då tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor både inom finance och till övriga grupper inom Telenor samt mot vår outsourcingpartner och andra koncernbolag.
* Van att arbeta självständigt på ett strukturerat och noggrant sätt
* Lösningsorienterad och driven
* Har sinne för detaljer men har förståelsen för att se helheten

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag på heltid via Incluso i Stockholm. Start är snarast möjligt och uppdraget är tidsbegränsat i 9 månader till att börja med.


Vänligen sök med CV och kort motivering via länken nedan. Vi presenterar kandidater löpande.

  

Ansvarig rekryterare på Incluso är Marianne Nilsson

title: Financial Controller – Ansvar för konsolidering och...
description:
Vi söker en erfaren **Financial Controller** till ett spännande uppdrag inom en stor och komplex organisation. Som Financial Controller kommer du att ha en central roll i konsolidering och rapportering av finansiella siffror, samt arbeta med processutveckling och förändringsarbete.

**Om rollen**  

I rollen som Financial Controller kommer du att:

* Ansvara för konsolidering och rapportering av finansiella siffror till group accounting.
* Arbeta med överlämning av uppgifter till Shared Service Center och sätta processer mellan kunden och Shared Service Center.
* Delta i projekt och förbättringsinitiativ inom Financial Control, utöver det löpande bokslutsarbetet.
* Driva förändringsarbete och processutveckling för att optimera finansiella flöden och rapporteringsprocesser.

**Vad vi erbjuder**

* En viktig och utmanande roll med stort ansvar inom koncernredovisning och finansiell rapportering.
* Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla arbetsprocesser i en komplex systemmiljö.
* En flexibel arbetsmiljö med distansmöjligheter (25%).
* Stöd från ett engagerat team och möjlighet att samarbeta med flera interna och externa aktörer.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har erfarenhet av koncernredovisning och är väl insatt i svenska redovisningsregelverk (K3) och IFRS.
* Har flerårig erfarenhet inom kvalificerad redovisning, gärna från större företag med komplex verksamhet.
* Är van att hantera stora datamängder och har mycket goda kunskaper i Excel.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med Shared Service Center och har arbetat med förändringsarbete och processutveckling.
* Är analytisk, noggrann och strukturerad, med en förmåga att se både detaljer och helheten.
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs i samarbete med andra funktioner och externa partners.
* Erfarenhet av Oracle EPM Cloud/FCC är meriterande.

**Placering och omfattning**

* Uppdraget är baserat i Stockholm.
* Start: 16 januari 2025
* Slut: 12 september 2025
* Omfattning: Heltid, 40 timmar/vecka (25% distansarbete).

**Språk**  

Flytande svenska krävs för rollen.

  

Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Commercial System & Improvements Expert till Coca-Cola Europacific Partners
description:
*Vi letar just nu efter en kollega som ser framtidens nya arbetssätt och kan omvandla det till verklighet. Som* ***Commercial System & Improvements Expert*** *har du intresse för system, dess möjligheter och inte minst förbättringar i våra kommersiella processer. Trivs du i en händelserik vardag där din insats gör skillnad? Då kan detta vara utmaningen du letat efter!*

  


**Om rollen**


Du kommer att tillhöra teamet Commercial System Development (tidigare Säljstöd) som är en del av vår Commercial Operations-avdelning, som är en del av vår fältsäljsorganisation. Tillsammans med dina kollegor arbetar ni med att underhålla och förbättra våra verktyg och kommersiella processer för att ge de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna till våra säljare och slutanvändare.


Du kommer att arbeta med att implementera strategiska initiativ som ligger till grund för våra affärsmål. Du kommer behöva ha en helhetssyn och vara bra på att förstå en användares behov i vardagen och i sin tur kunna förmedla informationen till våra globala team som jobbar med vidareutveckling och förbättring av våra verktyg. I rollen kommer du ha ett övergripande ansvar och ägarskap för ett urval av interna system och processer där du kommer vara länken mellan dem och slutanvändaren för att kunna säkerställa optimal effektivitet och prestanda. Exempel på CRM system och verktyg vi använder är Salesforce, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Genesys purecloud och Showpad.


I rollen kommer arbeta tillsammans med teamets övriga Commercial System & Improvements Expert. Du kommer även att jobba nära många andra olika interna team som exempelvis KAM, kommersiella supportavdelning och Fältsälj, men också våra centrala team likväl med tredjepartsleverantörer. Detta är en dynamisk och spännande roll där du driver projekt och förbättringar av system och processer kopplad till försäljning - allt för att stödja vår nuvarande och framtida route-to-market strategi för Coca-Cola Europacific Partners Sverige!


Rollen är baserad på vårt moderna huvudkontor (även kallad ”Happiness Factory) i Jordbro, söder om Stockholm.

**För att lyckas i rollen behöver du:**

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område är meriterande
* Vi ser gärna att du tidigare har arbetat i en supporterade roll eller i en supportfunktion. Meriterande om du har kunskap av försäljning och kommersiell support
* Goda systemkunskaper i Salesforce eller annat CRM system. Meriterande om du har kunskap i Sharepoint, Salesforce Marketing cloud, Power automate
* Goda kunskaper i Excel och Officepaketet
* Du kommer jobba tvärfunktionellt och ha många kontaktytor på både nationell och internationell nivå. Du behöver vara trygg i att kommunicera i både tal och skrift i svenska och engelska
* Gärna erfarenhet av att förstå och omvandla slutanvändarnas behov till systemkrav
* Stort intresse för och erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller leda projekt, utvecklings- och förbättringsarbete eller implementering av nya system och processer


Vi söker dig som är **strukturerad**, **proaktiv** och har en **stark förmåga att driva förändring** och ta ansvar. I rollen krävs det att man har **god systemvana** och **förståelse för hur data och system kan underlätta för slutanvändarna**, vilket du kombinerar med en **lösningsorienterad inställning**. Med din **kommunikativa och pedagogiska förmåga** bygger du starka relationer och skapar engagemang i förändringsprocesser.


Du har ett **starkt användarfokus**, en **serviceinriktad personlighet** och en **naturlig förmåga att samarbeta** med olika team och intressenter. Din **flexibilitet** och **anpassningsförmåga** gör att du snabbt kan navigera i en föränderlig miljö och säkerställa att prioriterade initiativ når sina mål. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du dessutom ha en **god analytisk förmåga,** vara **nyfiken på att lära dig nytt och kontinuerligt utvecklas**. Om du drivs av att skapa värde och påverka genom att förbättra system, processer och verktyg, då är detta rätt roll för dig!


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och vi värdesätter en varierad personalstyrka och välkomnar därför dig att söka oavsett kön, ålder eller etnisk bakgrund.

**Låter det intressant?**


Då rekommenderar vi dig att skicka in din ansökan senast 13/1. Vid frågor, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Hellen Song, hsong@ccep.com. Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar och CV via mail med anledning av GDPR.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

**Vi erbjuder dig**


Coca-Cola Europacific Partners är ett ledande konsumentvaruföretag och världens största oberoende buteljeringsföretag av Coca-Cola. Med ett team på 42 000 personer som servar kunder i 31 länder tillverkar, säljer och distribuerar vi världens mest älskade dryckesvarumärken. I Sverige har vi cirka 750 fantastiska medarbetare och varumärken som bl.a. Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, bonaqua, Powerade, MER och Monster.


Vi brukar säga, "You may join for the brand but stay for the people", och det stämmer verkligen! Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i en snabb och innovativ bransch tillsammans med våra anställda, kunder och konsumenter. Du kommer tillhöra ett dynamiskt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhet i alla led. Du får mycket eget ansvar från första dagen och du får möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad. Vårt recept på framgång är att vi är passionerade, hårt arbetande och engagerade i våra produkter, våra kunder och varandra. CCEP är en plats där människor kan växa, vara glada och må bra på en trygg, öppen och inkluderande arbetsplats. Om du vill du veta mer om människorna bakom våra drycker och dina framtida kollegor hos oss hittar du våra stories på https://www.coca-cola.se/100voices.


***You may join for the brand but stay for the people!***

title: Talent Brand Specialist
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters**  

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.


We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.

 **About the role**  

Are you a social superstar passionate about being creative and building relationships, ready to take on a new challenge in your career?


As our Talent Brand Specialist at Xensam, you’ll elevate our people and culture, becoming an internal influencer who turns the everyday moments into stories that inspire and attract others to join us. You will also play a role in attracting top talent by focusing on the early stages of the recruitment lifecycle and driving impactful employer branding initiatives. This dynamic role combines creativity and social engagement with operational recruitment excellence.


**Responsibilities**
  

In this position, you’ll be a part of the People & Culture team and will collaborate closely with our Marketing team to create compelling content that aligns with our brand and culture. You’ll also take on people-focused tasks, supporting the Talent Acquisition team to ensure a smooth and seamless recruitment process. Here’s what you’ll be up to:


* Strengthen Xensam’s employer brand to attract and retain top talent.
* Develop, measure, and report on recruitment and branding initiatives to continuously optimize performance.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to create engaging content for social media and recruitment campaigns.
* Plan, organize, and execute branding events while networking within the industry by both hosting and participating in them.
* Document events through photography, video, and surveys to capture insights.
* Manage the initial stages of the recruitment process, including attraction, sourcing, screening, and initial engagement.
* Proactively source and build a pipeline of pre-qualified candidates using various methods and tools.
* Ensure efficient screening and smooth handover of qualified candidates to hiring managers.

**Qualifications**


* Minimum of 1 year of experience in the relevant areas, i.e. employer branding, social media, marketing, recruitment, communication etc.
* Strong attention to detail with the ability to create content that aligns with Xensam’s brand and culture.
* Excellent collaboration skills to work effectively with stakeholders, including managers, marketing, HR etc.
* You thrive in social settings and are driven by a genuine passion and natural talent for building meaningful relationships.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.

**Bonus points if you have**

* A minimum of 1-2 years of post-secondary education in a relevant field, such as communication, social media, branding, or marketing.
* Hands-on experience in recruitment tasks such as sourcing, screening, and using tools like LinkedIn and Teamtailor.
* Hands-on experience managing social media platforms, such as Instagram & LinkedIn, to increase brand visibility.

**What you get**

* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.

At Xensam, our core values define our culture:


**Rebellious**: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.


**Humane**: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.


**Harmonious**: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.


Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, **APPLY now!**


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.


In your application, please include a portfolio or a link to your Instagram. Any type of material, whether social media or portfolio, is relevant and welcome. While not mandatory, it’s a significant advantage.

title: Information Security Manager
description:
In this role, you will:
   

  

* Lead the Information Security Management System (ISMS) and ensure compliance with GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2, AI Act/ISO 42001, and DORA. Conduct audits and maintain security policies.
* Enhance the sales process by completing GRC-related questions in RFPs and participating in customer calls to address security inquiries. Maintain and update security white papers and related documentation.
* Work cross-functionally across engineering, legal, and commercial teams to enhance security measures


 Your background looks something like:
   

  

* 2-5 years of professional experience in legal or operations
* Experience in a smaller SaaS company
* Preferred Education: MSc in Law, Engineering or related field
* Familiarity with one or more of the following: GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2, AI Act/ISO 42001, and DORA.


**What We Offer**
* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in NYC, London, and Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**About Sana**
 Sana exists to advance how humans access knowledge with artificial intelligence. Our AI products are trusted by the world’s most pioneering companies—from Polestar and Merck to Hinge Health and Svea Solar—and have served 1 million people worldwide.
   

  

 Sana has raised over $130m to date from world-leading investors including NEA, Menlo Ventures, and EQT Ventures. We have been featured as a LinkedIn Top Startup, named a winner in the AI and Data category for Fast Company’s 2024 Next Big Things in Tech, and recognized on the Forbes AI 50 list as one of the top AI companies developing the most promising business use cases of artificial intelligence.
   

  

 We believe advancing knowledge is the world’s most important problem to solve. From writing and the printing press to the internet and Google, the tools that have accelerated access to knowledge have defined human progress. Yet our workplace software hasn’t kept up. We’re building towards a world where knowledge is not only more accessible, but empowers you to accomplish more than you ever thought possible.
   

  

 If that’s a future that excites you, you’re in the right place. Come and do your life’s work with us.
